meanings.definition: A type of bread in Indian cuisine.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed the warm pitta with my curry.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served delicious pitta with hummus.
meanings.sent3: The pitta was so fluffy, it could have been a cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her pitta-making skills were like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked pitta filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: A type of dosha in Ayurvedic medicine.
meanings.sent1: According to Ayurveda, my dominant pitta causes me to be fiery.
meanings.sent2: Balancing pitta is essential for overall well-being in Ayurvedic practice.
meanings.sent3: His pitta was so imbalanced, he felt like a volcano ready to erupt.
meanings.sent4: She tried to cool her pitta dosha with calming teas and meditation.
meanings.sent5: The Ayurvedic practitioner recommended dietary changes to pacify her pitta dosha.

meanings.definition: A type of fire in Hindu philosophy.
meanings.sent1: The sacred pitta symbolized transformation and purification in Hindu beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The ritual required lighting the pitta to honor the gods.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child thought the pitta was a magical flame.
meanings.sent4: The intensity of the pitta burned away impurities of the soul.
meanings.sent5: The guru meditated by the pitta to connect with the divine energy.
